verses.kjv: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.
verses.ct: These are the instructions for the guilt offering: it is especially holy.

verses.kjv: In the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle round about upon the altar.
verses.ct: The guilt offering must be slaughtered in the same place where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and the priest must splash its blood on all sides of the altar.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,
verses.ct: The priest must present all of its fat: the fat tail, the fat covering the internal organs,

verses.kjv: And the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:
verses.ct: both kidneys with the fat on them near the lower back, and the lobe of the liver, which he must remove along with the kidneys.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the LORD: it is a trespass offering.
verses.ct: The priest must burn these pieces on the altar as a fire offering to the LORD. This is a guilt offering.

verses.kjv: Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.
verses.ct: Any male among the priests may eat it. It must be eaten in a holy place, because it is especially holy.

verses.kjv: As the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.
verses.ct: The guilt offering follows the same rules as the sin offering — the priest who performs the atonement with it gets to keep it.

verses.kjv: And the priest that offereth any man’s burnt offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath offered.
verses.ct: When a priest presents someone's burnt offering, that priest gets to keep the hide of the animal he offered.

verses.kjv: And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest’s that offereth it.
verses.ct: Every grain offering baked in an oven, or prepared in a deep pan or on a griddle, belongs to the priest who presents it.

verses.kjv: And every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as much as another.
verses.ct: But every grain offering, whether mixed with oil or dry, belongs equally to all of Aaron's sons — each one gets the same share.

verses.kjv: And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer unto the LORD.
verses.ct: These are the instructions for the peace offering that someone presents to the LORD.

verses.kjv: If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.
verses.ct: If someone offers it as an expression of thanks, then along with the thanksgiving sacrifice he must present unleavened bread mixed with oil, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and fried cakes of fine flour blended with oil.

verses.kjv: Besides the cakes, he shall offer for his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.
verses.ct: In addition to these cakes, he must also include loaves of leavened bread with his thanksgiving peace offering.

verses.kjv: And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation for an heave offering unto the LORD, and it shall be the priest’s that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.
verses.ct: From each type of bread, he must set aside one portion as a contribution to the LORD. It will belong to the priest who splashes the blood of the peace offering.

verses.kjv: And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
verses.ct: The meat from a thanksgiving peace offering must be eaten on the same day it is offered. None of it may be left until morning.

verses.kjv: But if the sacrifice of his offering be a vow, or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:
verses.ct: However, if the sacrifice is brought because of a vow or as a freewill offering, it should be eaten on the day it is offered, but whatever is left over may also be eaten the next day.

verses.kjv: But the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.
verses.ct: Any meat from the sacrifice still remaining on the 3rd day must be burned up in fire.

verses.kjv: And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it: it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.
verses.ct: If any meat from the peace offering is eaten on the 3rd day, the offering will not be accepted. It will not be credited to the person who brought it — it will be considered disgusting, and anyone who eats it will bear the consequences of that sin.

verses.kjv: And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean shall eat thereof.
verses.ct: Any meat that comes into contact with something unclean must not be eaten — it must be burned up. As for the rest of the meat, anyone who is ceremonially clean may eat it.

verses.kjv: But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: But if anyone eats meat from the LORD's peace offering while they are ceremonially unclean, that person must be excluded from their community.

verses.kjv: Moreover the soul that shall touch any unclean thing, as the uncleanness of man, or any unclean beast, or any abominable unclean thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which pertain unto the LORD, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: If anyone touches something unclean — whether human uncleanness, an unclean animal, or any disgusting unclean thing — and then eats meat from the LORD's peace offering, that person must be excluded from their community.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: You must never eat the fat of cattle, sheep, or goats.

verses.kjv: And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.
verses.ct: The fat from an animal that dies naturally or is killed by wild animals may be used for other purposes, but you must absolutely never eat it.

verses.kjv: For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: Whoever eats the fat from an animal of the type used as a fire offering to the LORD — that person must be excluded from their community.

verses.kjv: Moreover ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
verses.ct: Also, you must never consume any blood, whether from birds or animals, wherever you live.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever soul it be that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verses.ct: Anyone who consumes any kind of blood must be excluded from their community."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace offerings unto the LORD shall bring his oblation unto the LORD of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: Anyone who brings a peace offering to the LORD must personally bring part of it as their gift to the LORD.

verses.kjv: His own hands shall bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before the LORD.
verses.ct: With their own hands they must bring the fire offerings to the LORD. They must bring the fat along with the breast, and the breast must be lifted and waved as a wave offering in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron’s and his sons’.
verses.ct: The priest will burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons.

verses.kjv: And the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
verses.ct: You must also give the right thigh to the priest as a contribution from your peace offerings.

verses.kjv: He among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for his part.
verses.ct: The son of Aaron who splashes the blood and presents the fat of the peace offering gets the right thigh as his portion.

verses.kjv: For the wave breast and the heave shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons by a statute for ever from among the children of Israel.
verses.ct: I have taken the wave breast and the contribution thigh from the Israelites' peace offerings and given them to Aaron the priest and his sons as a permanent right from the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: This is the portion of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister unto the LORD in the priest’s office;
verses.ct: This is the designated portion from the LORD's fire offerings for Aaron and his sons, assigned to them on the day they were presented to serve the LORD as priests.

verses.kjv: Which the LORD commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, by a statute for ever throughout their generations.
verses.ct: The LORD commanded that the Israelites give this to them on the day they were anointed. It is a permanent regulation for all their future generations.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the peace offerings;
verses.ct: These are the instructions for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the peace offering —

verses.kjv: Which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.ct: which the LORD gave to Moses on Mount Sinai, on the day he commanded the Israelites to present their offerings to the LORD, in the Sinai wilderness.
